description: One of the key features I like about Finder in OS X was the quick-look using space bar to preview images, videos, pdfs, &c. Sushi handles the media files I've tried it with perfectly: mp4, jpg, png. More complex files, notably pdf or others used in LibreOffice or in Kate, aren't appearing as a preview, but that's my only knock against it. Installed basically instantly and worked immediately in Nautilus. Glad this exists!
Sushi causes a full freeze of the OS when attempting to preview e.g. a pptx file.
Just like on my old Mac, I can hit space to get a preview of files!
and Dolphin, making it pretty much useless outside Nautilus. The app itself is really fast which is great.  But limited due to the above.
summary: No way to integrate into KDE..
